result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Singh Gill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety By Use Of A Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for childcare.
Contact the probation and parole office by 5:00 p.m. on 10/21/2022.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of firearms and weapons.
Complete a firearm safety course at Milwaukee Area Technical College.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on 10/20/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

timeConds.notes:
Report date 10/20/2022.  
Huber privileges for childcare.  Defendant eligible for good time credit and electronic monitoring.

charges.descr: Endangering  Safety By Use Of A Dangerous Weapon

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Singh Gill

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey Singh Gill in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Corey Singh Gill.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for THREE (3) DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for Childcare.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  NINE (9) MONTHS/YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
*-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 10/21/2022.  
*-Serve TEN (10) DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for Childcare. Report Date: _10/20/2022___ Defendant eligible for good time credit and electronic monitoring. 
*-Complete 20 hours of community service.
*-No use or possession of firearms and weapons. 
*-Complete a firearm safety course at  Milwaukee Area Technical College.

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/20/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 


*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Corey Singh Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Corey Singh Gill.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests resolution date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corey Singh Gill in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corey Singh Gill appeared by video means with Attorney. 
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in need of offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Corey Singh Gill in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @2p
